Class BoardHandler

java.lang.Object
logic.GravityHandler
logic.BoardHandler
public class BoardHandler extends GravityHandler
The BoardHandler class runs the logic for finding the best move given a 2D array of a board. The class keeps track of 2 2D arrays for 2 boards, one for each perspective of each player, as the logic sees 1 as the friendly pieces and 2 as the enemy pieces.

  • Method Details

    • lowestRow

      public int lowestRow(int column)
      Looks for the lowest row available in a specified column for placing a piece into.
      Parameters:
      column - the user-defined column to look into
      Returns:
      an int indicating the lowest unoccupied row

    • placePiece

      public void placePiece(int column, int player)
      Adds a piece into the lowest position on both boards with opposite integer tags so algorithm can aid both sides
      Parameters:
      column - the user-defined column to place a piece into
      player - the player to place a piece for

    • nextMove

      public int nextMove(int boardSelection)
      analyzes a board through method findBestMove and returns its output, which is the best move for that current board position
      Parameters:
      boardSelection - int selection for either player 1 or 2's board
      Returns:
      The best move given the board

    • isWin

      public boolean isWin(boolean currentTurn)
      checks the given board whether there is a winning set of 4 pieces or not using the checkForWin method
      Parameters:
      currentTurn - Boolean true/false for indicating player 1/2's turn
      Returns:
      true if there is a consecutive set of 4 1's indicating a win for that player

    • dump

      public void dump()
      debugging method for dumping both boards and seeing if back-end is entering pieces into the right positions

    • findBestMove

      public int findBestMove(int[][] board)
      Iterates through placing a piece in each column and calling upon evalBoard() to rate the position
      Parameters:
      board - the game board being passed in
      Returns:
      the column for the best move

    • checkForWin

      public boolean checkForWin(int[][] board)
      checks if there are 4 same-player pieces in a row and gives a true-or-false return
      Parameters:
      board - the game board in a 2D array
      Returns:
      true if 4 pieces are in a row in any orientation

    • evalBoard

      public int evalBoard(int[][] board)
      evaluates and gives a total score for the entire board situation
      Parameters:
      board - the game board in a 2D array
      Returns:
      a total board score based on rateLine's output of each set of 4 adjacent spots

    • rateLine

      public int rateLine(int a, int b, int c, int d)
      Rates a group of 4 pieces and assigns a score based on amount of pieces in a row
      Parameters:
      a - first piece in row
      b - second piece in row
      c - third piece in row
      d - fourth piece in row
      Returns:
      a score based on amount of user and opponent pieces in a row

    • pieceCounter

      public int pieceCounter(int[] line, int player)
      pieceCounter counts a player's pieces in a row for any given 4 adjacent pieces.
      Parameters:
      line - an array of 4 adjacent pieces in any orientation specified by rateLine
      player - indicates if method should check for player 1 (user) or player 2 (opponent)'s pieces
      Returns:
      the amount of pieces that are in a row
